intro: Ornithogalum flaccidum, commonly known as the flaccid star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and summer months. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground storage organs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
